name: Riad Chamali

reviews.text: My friend and I (both female) stayed here for three nights in the Gnaoua room., and I thought what we got for the price, which was only 30 euros, was excellent. Ok so it was a shared bathroom, but the communal areas were attractive, the staff were lovely, bringing us breakfast on the terrace, and the place was spotless. We looked at other places but would have had to stay in a dorm for the same money. The riad is located by the Royal Palace, south of the mellah, which is about a 20 minute walk from the square, so isn't brilliant if you don't like walking. However on the way you pass through many interesting sites, the mellah market (a much more authentic feel than the main roads of the souks), the excellent kosybar and tanjir bars for a late night drink, lots of hammams, shops etc. Seeing some reviews of other riads makes me think people have unrealistic expectations of what they will get for their money, so don't expect luxury rooms or 5 star service or no- dirt on the street, local kids being kids, dust or hassle because that is what marrakech is like and if these things offend you then you shouldn't go there. But if you like simple clean attractive accomodation with lots of character then this place is great and I would go back tomorrow!
reviews.title: Great value riad!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Riad Chamali is a lovely guesthouse in the middle of quite a suburban area (about 20mins walk from the main square). It's almost impossible to find on your own, we arrived at dark and were actually a bit scared! It does seem to be in quite a shady part of town.
reviews.title: Beautiful Riad - but be warned if you are not bilingual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately the Riad did not send a driver to pick us up, even though I had asked for one... maybe this was a mistake due to the language barrier, but we ended up having to get a taxi from the airport, then paying a local boy to take us to the Riad!
reviews.title: Gorgeous Riad - Peaceful Haven in Crazy Marrakech!

reviews.text: I would advise anyone who is booking that the staff there speak NO ENGLISH at all, not even a little bit. We struggled a bit to converse with the staff there, although this is due to our own ignorance as they spoke French, Spanish and Arabic, but unfortunately no English. This made it difficult to ask for things we needed... on the first morning we wanted to ask where things were, how to book tours etc, but weren't able to - although we did get by with my very basic French!
reviews.title: Incredible value for money

reviews.text: Our room cost €60 a night, it was a very nice room, big and with a WC/hot shower, although it wasn't as cheap as I thought it would be. I think Marrakech has been hit by the tourist boom so don't expect things to be as cheap as you would imagine!
reviews.title: une oasis de tranquilité, un reve marocain, à petits prix

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was lovely, fresh breads, butter and jam, with coffee or tea. The staff were all very nice and professional, but I would say if you don't know ANY French or Spanish to consider this before booking the hotel.
reviews.title: Amazing value hidden gem

description: Masked by its unassuming façade, lies a haven of luxuriant calm. Pass through its portals to enter the enchanted world of a traditional medina, where you will be embraced by the Moroccan art of living and overwhelmed by so much to discover. Personalized service with a caring staff to enjoy the tranquility of the six rooms.Home airport, evening and traditional cuisine, car rental, steam neighborhood. Many services to make your stay unforgettable. Hidden in the medina in the heart of a labyrinth of alleys, opened a haven of peace delivering you the enchanting world of a riad in the authentic preserved. You will taste the Moroccan art of living, real dazzle to your sense of wonder..
